verses.text: Elihu also proceeded, and said,

similars.text: Furthermore Elihu answered and said,
Elihu spake moreover, and said,
Elihu spake moreover, and said,
Elihu spake moreover, and said,
Furthermore Elihu answered and said,

verses.text: Suffer me a little, and I will shew thee that I have yet to speak on God's behalf.

similars.text: Yet ye have not hearkened unto me, saith the Lord; that ye might provoke me to anger with the works of your hands to your own hurt.

verses.text: I will fetch my knowledge from afar, and will ascribe righteousness to my Maker.

similars.text: Deal bountifully with thy servant, that I may live, and keep thy word.
For I will raise up unto myself a pure people, that will serve me in righteousness;
He shall see the travail of his soul, and shall be satisfied; by his knowledge shall my righteous servant justify many; for he shall bear their iniquities.

verses.text: For truly my words shall not be false: he that is perfect in knowledge is with thee.

similars.text: Now, as I said concerning faith--that it was not a perfect knowledge--even so it is with my words. Ye cannot know of their surety at first, unto perfection, any more than faith is a perfect knowledge.

verses.text: Behold, God is mighty, and despiseth not any: he is mighty in strength and wisdom.

similars.text: Behold, happy is the man whom God correcteth: therefore despise not thou the chastening of the Almighty:
For the Lord your God is God of gods, and Lord of lords, a great God, a mighty, and a terrible, which regardeth not persons, nor taketh reward:
Thou shalt not be affrighted at them: for the Lord thy God is among you, a mighty God and terrible.
He is wise in heart, and mighty in strength: who hath hardened himself against him, and hath prospered?
Thou art the God that doest wonders: thou hast declared thy strength among the people.
Thus saith the Lord, Let not the wise man glory in his wisdom, neither let the mighty man glory in his might, let not the rich man glory in his riches:
He therefore that despiseth, despiseth not man, but God, who hath also given unto us his holy Spirit.
He poureth contempt upon princes, and weakeneth the strength of the mighty.
Behold, God is great, and we know him not, neither can the number of his years be searched out.
Behold, God exalteth by his power: who teacheth like him?

verses.text: He preserveth not the life of the wicked: but giveth right to the poor.

similars.text: He shall spare the poor and needy, and shall save the souls of the needy.
Thou shalt not wrest the judgment of thy poor in his cause.
But he saveth the poor from the sword, from their mouth, and from the hand of the mighty.
For he shall stand at the right hand of the poor, to save him from those that condemn his soul.
The righteous considereth the cause of the poor: but the wicked regardeth not to know it.
I know that the Lord will maintain the cause of the afflicted, and the right of the poor.
The Lord preserveth the strangers; he relieveth the fatherless and widow: but the way of the wicked he turneth upside down.
The Lord will not suffer the soul of the righteous to famish: but he casteth away the substance of the wicked.

verses.text: He withdraweth not his eyes from the righteous: but with kings are they on the throne; yea, he doth establish them for ever, and they are exalted.

similars.text: He ruleth by his power for ever; his eyes behold the nations: let not the rebellious exalt themselves. Selah.
The king that faithfully judgeth the poor, his throne shall be established for ever.

verses.text: And if they be bound in fetters, and be holden in cords of affliction;
Then he sheweth them their work, and their transgressions that they have exceeded.
He openeth also their ear to discipline, and commandeth that they return from iniquity.

similars.text: Then he openeth the ears of men, and sealeth their instruction,
And he said unto them, He that hath ears to hear, let him hear.
He delivereth the poor in his affliction, and openeth their ears in oppression.

verses.text: If they obey and serve him, they shall spend their days in prosperity, and their years in pleasures.

similars.text: Let them shout for joy, and be glad, that favour my righteous cause: yea, let them say continually, Let the Lord be magnified, which hath pleasure in the prosperity of his servant.
And they spake unto him, saying, If thou be kind to this people, and please them, and speak good words to them, they will be thy servants for ever.
It hath pleased them verily; and their debtors they are. For if the Gentiles have been made partakers of their spiritual things, their duty is also to minister unto them in carnal things.

verses.text: But if they obey not, they shall perish by the sword, and they shall die without knowledge.

similars.text: All the sinners of my people shall die by the sword, which say, The evil shall not overtake nor prevent us.

verses.text: But the hypocrites in heart heap up wrath: they cry not when he bindeth them.

similars.text: Therefore the Lord shall have no joy in their young men, neither shall have mercy on their fatherless and widows; for every one of them is a hypocrite and an evildoer, and every mouth speaketh folly. For all this his anger is not turned away, but his hand is stretched out still.

Therefore the Lord shall have no joy in their young men, neither shall have mercy on their fatherless and widows: for every one is an hypocrite and an evildoer, and every mouth speaketh folly. For all this his anger is not turned away, but his hand is stretched out still.
Howbeit he will not stretch out his hand to the grave, though they cry in his destruction.

verses.text: They die in youth, and their life is among the unclean.
He delivereth the poor in his affliction, and openeth their ears in oppression.

similars.text: So that they cause the cry of the poor to come unto him, and he heareth the cry of the afflicted.
Sing unto the Lord, praise ye the Lord: for he hath delivered the soul of the poor from the hand of evildoers.
Whoso stoppeth his ears at the cry of the poor, he also shall cry himself, but shall not be heard.
And he said unto them, He that hath ears to hear, let him hear.
Bow down thine ear, O Lord, hear me: for I am poor and needy.
Then he openeth the ears of men, and sealeth their instruction,

He that walketh righteously, and speaketh uprightly; he that despiseth the gain of oppressions, that shaketh his hands from holding of bribes, that stoppeth his ears from hearing of blood, and shutteth his eyes from seeing evil;

Behold, it is expedient that much should be done among this people, because of the hardness of their hearts, and the deafness of their ears, and the blindness of their minds, and the stiffness of their necks; nevertheless, God is exceedingly merciful unto them, and has not as yet swept them off from the face of the land.
He that oppresseth the poor reproacheth his Maker: but he that honoureth him hath mercy on the poor.
For he shall deliver the needy when he crieth; the poor also, and him that hath no helper.
For the Lord heareth the poor, and despiseth not his prisoners.
For the oppression of the poor, for the sighing of the needy, now will I arise, saith the Lord; I will set him in safety from him that puffeth at him.
The wicked in his pride doth persecute the poor: let them be taken in the devices that they have imagined.
Incline thine ear, O Lord, and hear; open thine eyes, O Lord, and see: and hear all the words of Sennacherib, which hath sent to reproach the living God.
Lord, bow down thine ear, and hear: open, Lord, thine eyes, and see: and hear the words of Sennacherib, which hath sent him to reproach the living God.

And he lifted up his voice to heaven, and cried, saying: O, how long, O Lord, wilt thou suffer that thy servants shall dwell here below in the flesh, to behold such gross wickedness among the children of men?
The righteous cry, and the Lord heareth, and delivereth them out of all their troubles.
Open thy mouth, judge righteously, and plead the cause of the poor and needy.
He shall judge the poor of the people, he shall save the children of the needy, and shall break in pieces the oppressor.
The Lord maketh poor, and maketh rich: he bringeth low, and lifteth up.
The eyes of the Lord are upon the righteous, and his ears are open unto their cry.
He that giveth unto the poor shall not lack: but he that hideth his eyes shall have many a curse.
Thou knowest, O Lord, that they have been greatly oppressed and afflicted by wicked men; and our hearts flow out with sorrow because of their grievous burdens.
He openeth also their ear to discipline, and commandeth that they return from iniquity.
All my bones shall say, Lord, who is like unto thee, which deliverest the poor from him that is too strong for him, yea, the poor and the needy from him that spoileth him?

And behold, others he flattereth away, and telleth them there is no hell; and he saith unto them: I am no devil, for there is none--and thus he whispereth in their ears, until he grasps them with his awful chains, from whence there is no deliverance.
Deliver me in thy righteousness, and cause me to escape: incline thine ear unto me, and save me.

And it came to pass that the voice of the Lord came to them in their afflictions, saying: Lift up your heads and be of good comfort, for I know of the covenant which ye have made unto me; and I will covenant with my people and deliver them out of bondage.
The Lord openeth the eyes of the blind: the Lord raiseth them that are bowed down: the Lord loveth the righteous:
He was oppressed, and he was afflicted, yet he opened not his mouth: he is brought as a lamb to the slaughter, and as a sheep before her shearers is dumb, so he openeth not his mouth.
So that they cause the cry of the poor to come unto him, and he heareth the cry of the afflicted.

verses.text: Even so would he have removed thee out of the strait into a broad place, where there is no straitness; and that which should be set on thy table should be full of fatness.
But thou hast fulfilled the judgment of the wicked: judgment and justice take hold on thee.

similars.text: Therefore the law is slacked, and judgment doth never go forth: for the wicked doth compass about the righteous; therefore wrong judgment proceedeth.
Therefore remember, O man, for all thy doings thou shalt be brought into judgment.

And thou hast taken Zion to thine own bosom, from all thy creations, from all eternity to all eternity; and naught but peace, justice, and truth is the habitation of thy throne; and mercy shall go before thy face and have no end; how is it thou canst weep?
For thou hast maintained my right and my cause; thou satest in the throne judging right.

verses.text: Because there is wrath, beware lest he take thee away with his stroke: then a great ransom cannot deliver thee.

similars.text: A man of great wrath shall suffer punishment: for if thou deliver him, yet thou must do it again.

verses.text: Will he esteem thy riches? no, not gold, nor all the forces of strength.

similars.text: So is he that layeth up treasure for himself, and is not rich toward God.
A faithful man shall abound with blessings: but he that maketh haste to be rich shall not be innocent.
Trust not in oppression, and become not vain in robbery: if riches increase, set not your heart upon them.
In me he shall have glory, and not of himself, whether in weakness or in strength, whether in bonds or free;
Thus saith the Lord, Let not the wise man glory in his wisdom, neither let the mighty man glory in his might, let not the rich man glory in his riches:

verses.text: Desire not the night, when people are cut off in their place.
Take heed, regard not iniquity: for this hast thou chosen rather than affliction.

similars.text: Take heed to thyself that thou offer not thy burnt offerings in every place that thou seest:
Take heed to thyself that thou forsake not the Levite as long as thou livest upon the earth.
Seek not to be cumbered. Forsake all unrighteousness. Commit not adultery--a temptation with which thou hast been troubled.
If iniquity be in thine hand, put it far away, and let not wickedness dwell in thy tabernacles.
Consider mine affliction, and deliver me: for I do not forget thy law.

verses.text: Behold, God exalteth by his power: who teacheth like him?

similars.text: Who opposeth and exalteth himself above all that is called God, or that is worshipped; so that he as God sitteth in the temple of God, shewing himself that he is God.
For his God doth instruct him to discretion, and doth teach him.
Behold, God is mighty, and despiseth not any: he is mighty in strength and wisdom.

verses.text: Who hath enjoined him his way? or who can say, Thou hast wrought iniquity?

similars.text: To whom hast thou uttered words? and whose spirit came from thee?
Hast thou not procured this unto thyself, in that thou hast forsaken the Lord thy God, when he led thee by the way?
And he said unto him, Thou hast answered right: this do, and thou shalt live.
What hast thou here? and whom hast thou here, that thou hast hewed thee out a sepulchre here, as he that heweth him out a sepulchre on high, and that graveth an habitation for himself in a rock?

verses.text: Remember that thou magnify his work, which men behold.

similars.text: What is man, that thou shouldest magnify him? and that thou shouldest set thine heart upon him?
What is man, that thou shouldest magnify him? and that thou shouldest set thine heart upon him?

verses.text: Every man may see it; man may behold it afar off.
Behold, God is great, and we know him not, neither can the number of his years be searched out.

similars.text: Great is the Lord, and greatly to be praised; and his greatness is unsearchable.

Behold, great and marvelous are the works of the Lord. How unsearchable are the depths of the mysteries of him; and it is impossible that man should find out all his ways. And no man knoweth of his ways save it be revealed unto him; wherefore, brethren, despise not the revelations of God.
Behold, God is mighty, and despiseth not any: he is mighty in strength and wisdom.
Great is the Lord, and greatly to be praised; and his greatness is unsearchable.

verses.text: For he maketh small the drops of water: they pour down rain according to the vapour thereof:
Which the clouds do drop and distil upon man abundantly.
Also can any understand the spreadings of the clouds, or the noise of his tabernacle?
Behold, he spreadeth his light upon it, and covereth the bottom of the sea.

similars.text: Which alone spreadeth out the heavens, and treadeth upon the waves of the sea.
For he hath founded it upon the seas, and established it upon the floods.

verses.text: For by them judgeth he the people; he giveth meat in abundance.

similars.text: And when they had eaten and were filled, he commanded that they should give unto the multitude.
And the Lord said, Who then is that faithful and wise steward, whom his lord shall make ruler over his household, to give them their portion of meat in due season?
He shall judge thy people with righteousness, and thy poor with judgment.
Blessed are those servants, whom the lord when he cometh shall find watching: verily I say unto you, that he shall gird himself, and make them to sit down to meat, and will come forth and serve them.
These wait all upon thee; that thou mayest give them their meat in due season.
The eyes of all wait upon thee; and thou givest them their meat in due season.
Who, then, is a faithful and wise servant, whom his lord hath made ruler over his household, to give them meat in due season?
Who then is a faithful and wise servant, whom his lord hath made ruler over his household, to give them meat in due season?
For unto every one that hath shall be given, and he shall have abundance: but from him that hath not shall be taken away even that which he hath.

verses.text: With clouds he covereth the light; and commandeth it not to shine by the cloud that cometh betwixt.

similars.text: Thick clouds are a covering to him, that he seeth not; and he walketh in the circuit of heaven.
He spread a cloud for a covering; and fire to give light in the night.
Thou hast covered thyself with a cloud, that our prayer should not pass through.
Also by watering he wearieth the thick cloud: he scattereth his bright cloud:
And when I shall put thee out, I will cover the heaven, and make the stars thereof dark; I will cover the sun with a cloud, and the moon shall not give her light.
So it was alway: the cloud covered it by day, and the appearance of fire by night.
He that observeth the wind shall not sow; and he that regardeth the clouds shall not reap.

Yet thou in thy manifold mercies forsookest them not in the wilderness: the pillar of the cloud departed not from them by day, to lead them in the way; neither the pillar of fire by night, to shew them light, and the way wherein they should go.

verses.text: The noise thereof sheweth concerning it, the cattle also concerning the vapour.
